public class XMLUtils
extends Object

The class XMLUtils contains methods used to manipulate XML Elements

Method Detail

buildDocument

public static org.jdom.Document buildDocument(String xmlFileName)
                                       throws IOException,
                                              org.jdom.JDOMException
Build a JDOM XML document from the XML File name. This is a utility class that knows how to read the relative paths of DTDs by obtaining the DTD base from the AppConfig class

Parameters:
xmlFileName - the name of the XML file that is to be parsed
Returns:
return the parsed document
Throws:
IOException - if error reading the DTD
org.jdom.JDOMException - when any error parsing the xml document

a boolean value
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs

                                 String xmlFileName)
                          throws IOException
Write the xml document to the hard disk.

Parameters:
document - The JDOM document object
xmlFileName - The name of the xml file
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs

compareDocTypes

private static boolean compareDocTypes(org.jdom.DocType first,
                                       org.jdom.DocType second)
The compareDocTypes method compares the document types definition of the two doctypes passed as parameters. Presently this method compares the element name the public ID and the system ID of the doc types to make comparison.

Parameters:
first - a DocType value
second - a DocType value
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the doc types are same based on the above definition, false otherwise.

compareElements

public static boolean compareElements(org.jdom.Element first,
                                      org.jdom.Element second,
                                      HashSet ignoreHash,
                                      boolean ignoreOrder)
The compareElements method compares the two elements passed as parameters. This method operates recursively to compare the child elements. Elements are considered same if they have the same name and text and have the same number of child elements in the same order.

Parameters:
first - an Element value
second - an Element value
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the two elements are same based on the above difinition, false othrewise

compareDocuments

public static boolean compareDocuments(String firstFileName,
                                       String secondFileName)
                                throws IOException,
                                       org.jdom.JDOMException
The compareDocuments method compares the two XML Files whose names are passed as parameters. The documents are considered to be same if the doc types definition is the same and all the elements are same and occur in the same order, including all the child elements

Parameters:
firstFileName - a String value for the first file name
secondFileName - a String value for the second file name
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the two dicuments are same, false otherwise
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs parsing the XML file
org.jdom.JDOMException - if an error occurs parsing the XML file

compareDocuments

public static boolean compareDocuments(String firstFileName,
                                       String secondFileName,
                                       String[] ignoreElements)
                                throws IOException,
                                       org.jdom.JDOMException
The compareDocuments method compares the two XML Files whose names are passed as parameters. The documents are considered to be same if the doc types definition is the same and all the elements are same and occur in the same order, including all the child elements

Parameters:
firstFileName - a String value for the first file name
secondFileName - a String value for the second file name
ignoreElements - a String[] containing the names of elements to ignore when comparing
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the two dicuments are same, false otherwise
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs parsing the XML file
org.jdom.JDOMException - if an error occurs parsing the XML file

compareDocuments

                                       String secondFileName,
                                       String[] ignoreElements,
                                       boolean ignoreOrder)
                                throws IOException,

The compareDocuments method compares the two XML Files whose names are passed as parameters. The documents are considered to be same if the doc types definition is the same and all the elements are same and occur in the same order, including all the child elements

Parameters:
firstFileName - a String value for the first file name
secondFileName - a String value for the second file name
ignoreElements - a String[] containing the names of elements to ignore when comparing
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the two dicuments are same, false otherwise
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs parsing the XML file
org.jdom.JDOMException - if an error occurs parsing the XML file

compareDocuments

public static boolean compareDocuments(org.jdom.Document firstDoc,
                                       org.jdom.Document secondDoc)
The compareDocuments method compares two XML documents to make sure that both the documents are the same in the sense that they have the same elements and data. White space differences are ignored when comparing documents. This method is a shell method that creates an empty ignores hash and delegates the actual processing to the compareDocs method.

Parameters:
firstDoc - a Document which is to be compared
secondDoc - a Document that is compared to
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the two documents are same, false otherwise

compareDocuments

public static boolean compareDocuments(org.jdom.Document firstDoc,
                                       org.jdom.Document secondDoc,
                                       String[] ignoreElements)
The compareDocuments method compares two XML documents to make sure that both the documents are the same in the sense that they have the same elements and data. White space differences are ignored when comparing documents. This method also ignores all the elements whose names are specified in the ignoreElements array. This is typically useful when elements such as StartTime and EndTime are to be ignored

Parameters:
firstDoc - a Document which is to be compared
secondDoc - a Document that is compared to
ignoreElements - a String[] containing the names of elements to ignore when comparing
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the two documents are same, false otherwise

compareDocuments

public static boolean compareDocuments(org.jdom.Document firstDoc,
                                       org.jdom.Document secondDoc,
                                       String[] ignoreElements,
                                       boolean ignoreOrder)
The compareDocuments method compares two XML documents to make sure that both the documents are the same in the sense that they have the same elements and data. White space differences are ignored when comparing documents. This method also ignores all the elements whose names are specified in the ignoreElements array. This is typically useful when elements such as StartTime and EndTime are to be ignored

Parameters:
firstDoc - a Document which is to be compared
secondDoc - a Document that is compared to
ignoreElements - a String[] containing the names of elements to ignore when comparing
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the two documents are same, false otherwise

compareDocs

public static boolean compareDocs(org.jdom.Document firstDoc,
                                  org.jdom.Document secondDoc,
                                  HashSet ignoreHash)
The compareDocuments method compares two XML documents to make sure that both the documents are the same in the sense that they have the same elements and data. White space differences are ignored when comparing documents

Parameters:
firstDoc - a Document which is to be compared
secondDoc - a Document that is compared to
Returns:
a boolean value of true if the two dicuments are same, false otherwise
